page.title: 09FARMING AT DALTON.
page.content: Most of the farms at{Dalton}are{mixed} which is dairy and arable. This years's{crops}are rape, winter and spring barley, potatoes, typhon (cross between a cabbage and a turnip) and hay. They use many{machines}such as tractors, potato planters, combine harvesters, trailers, spreaders and cooling fans. Farmers get up very {early}about{six o'clock.}The{first job is to{milk the cows}and{'muck'}them out. Farmers work about{fifteen hours} a day at{harvest time}and{twelve hours a day in{Winter.}The job is{very hard {work.}The{soil}at{Dalton}is{sandy}at the top of the slopes and{clay}at the bottom. Nearly all the land at{Dalton} is{owned by}the{South Yorkshire County {Council}and the land is{divided}into farms about{seventy acres,}which are {classed as small farms. }
